result.execSummary:
The defendant Melody V. Nieves was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Melody V. Nieves is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Melody V. Nieves was found guilty of Child Abuse-Intentionally Cause Harm, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(2)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  
*  Pay supervision fees.  
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  
*  Submit to a DNA sample (unless previously provided) and pay surcharge.  
DOC shall promptly notify the Court of any new arrest or criminal charge made against the deft.
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.

timeConds.notes: COMMENCE FORTHWITH  -  Huber privileges are allowed if working.  It is the Court's expectation that all non-working hours are to be spent in the KCJ subject to the authority granted to the Sheriff under the Statutes.

supervisions.notes: PROBATION HAS BEEN REVOKED.  TO COMMENCE FORTHWITH.

superMiscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.

*  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
DOC shall promptly notify the Court of any new arrest or criminal charge made against the Deft.
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
ALL UNPAID COURT COSTS ARE STILL DUE.

Deft not eligible for CIP or SAP.  Appeal rights.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Kraus appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Angela Komp.  Case is resolved.  Deft pleads guilty to count 1; found guilty by the Court.  PSI ordered.  Sentencing set for 2/3/15 @ 1:30pm.  Count 2 is dismissed on State's motion.
